Question
========

Young men in a population have an average height of 170 cm and a standard deviation of 6.75 cm. Young women have a mean height of 160 cm and a standard deviation of 6.25 cm. Both distributions are approximately normal. A young man and a young woman are chosen at random. Which answer describes the sample distribution the difference in height between the chosen man and the chosen woman?

Answerlist
----------

* This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 10 and a standard error of 0.50.
* This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 10 and a standard error of 9.20.
* This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 165 and a standard error of 13.
* This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 101.9 and a standard error of 13.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 10 and a standard error of 0.50: Incorrect
* This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 10 and a standard error of 9.20: Correct
* This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 165 and a standard error of 13: Incorrect
* This sample distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 101.9 and a standard error of 13: Incorrect
